p.s: In the given excerpt the reader is introduced to a new side of Gatsby in which he shows an unsualunusual and non expected behaviour.
He is uneasy and scared because of his meeting with Daisy, the love of his life, after 5 years.
When Gatsby firstly shows up in this excerpt he seems like a new man.
Nick describes him as pale as death (p. 84, l. 14), his hands are in his pockets, his posture is limp which shows that he is unsure of himself (p. 84 l. 14ff.).
When they enter, Gatsby doesn't talk or only in very short sentences, he doesn't look at Daisy and his nervousness shows ofoff (p. 84 l. 21 p. 85 l. 21).
He sits stiflystiffly on the sofa and all three of them feel embaressedembarrassed but support the akwardawkward silence.
No one really starts a conversation and one can feel that Gatsby does not know how to act around Daisy.
His uncertainty and embarressementembarrassment probably also make Daisy feel uneasy and embarressedembarrassed.
The scene has an odd touch and it seems like two teenagers sit in the same room and do not know how to act around each other because they do not know how the other person feels.
Nick also realizes this and says this to Gatsby after he pulled Nick aside when he wanted to leave (p. 85 l. 26 - p. 86 l. 9).
In this conversation Gatsby reveals that he regrets his plan and thinks that he is making a mistake (p. 86 l. 1).
He almost panics because not everything works the way he wanted it to.
For him, his behaviour is probably also something he does not usually do and maybe he even feels like he does not know himself.
His nervousness and fear overwhelm him and keep him from talking to Daisy.
When Nick tells Gatsby that his behaviour is rude and that Daisy also feels embarressedembarrassed, he listens and reenters the room more confident (p. 86 l. 3-12).
While Nick is outside we don't know how the situation inside goes on but when he reenters there is a complete dynamic change.
Even though Daisy is crying, the situation is more relaxed and not so tense and akwardawkward anymore.
Daisy is more quiet but Gatsby is his old self again.
He is excited, happy and calls Nick by his nickname (p. 87 l. 11-16) again.
There is no sign of the nervous almost childish and embarressedembarrassed Gatsby.
A talk between him and Daisy made him relax and shake off his unsureness.
He becomes the man he was in the previous chapters again and is now ready to make the next step.
He wants to show Daisy his house with his belonging so she knows how rich he is and what he could offer her (p. 87 l. 25).
By this he hopes to win her back so they can start a new life together.
Furthermore, Nick describes Gatsby as glowing (p. 87 l. 14) and his happiness transmits to Daisy even though she hasn't fully recovered.
GatsbysGatsby's behaviour in this scene especially in the beginning is extremlyextremely different compared to his behaviour in the rest of the book.
Usually he is very mysterious and does not reveal totoo much about himself.
Whenever he can he shows off how wealthy and rich he is.
Towards Nick he is more open, very talkative and seems like he wants to impress him (p. 63-65).
In general he doesn't really show other emotions than happiness which is why it is uncommon that he acts so nervously.
His weird and unusual behaviour is based on Daisy or to be more clearly on his meeting with Daisy.
He waited for a very long time, his expectations are high and when he sees her for the first time again it is natural that he reacts they way he does.
Moreover GatsbysGatsby's behaviour also suprises Nick.
He only knows the rich, sure of himself and mysterious Gatsby.
In this chapter a new side is being introduced to the reader as well as Nick.
The uncertainty of Gatsby transmits to Nick, makes him feel uncomfortable and that is why he wants to leave.
A big important part is being left out because we only see the situation through NicksNick's eyes and he decided to go outside.
This leaves Nick as well as the reader with the question what Gatsby and Daisy could have possibly talked about so that GatsbysGatsby's mood completely changed.
To come to a conclusion, GatsbysGatsby's behaviour shows that he is madly in love with Daisy but firstly is unsure of her feelings, which makes him feel nervous and uncertain.
After a long talk, he and Daisy were able to think about their past.
Something in this conversation made him relax and gave him hope as well as safety.
He is now able to become his old self again and do what his plan was in the first place.
